text: Nation of immigrants is a belief. Nation of immigrants is a belief that the United States of America is a nation made up of immigrants. That means: Nation of immigrants is a belief that the United States of America is a group of people with a shared language; Nation of immigrants is a belief that the United States of America is a group of people with a shared history; Nation of immigrants is a belief that the United States of America is a group of people with a shared culture; Nation of immigrants is a belief that the United States of America is a group of people who came to the United States of America recently. Part of the reason the set of words "nation of immigrants" is used so much is that the 35th president of the United States of America made it the name of his book.http://www.harpercollins.com/products/a-nation-of-immigrants- john-f-kennedy?variant=32218003570722http://www.pbs.org/kenburns/us-and-the- holocaust/what-does-it-mean-to-be-a-land-of- immigrantshttp://www.jfklibrary.org/about-us/social-media-podcasts-and- apps/jfk35-podcast/season-1/jfk-and-a-nation-of- immigrants/transcripthttp://www.adl.org/sites/default/files/Nation%20Of%20Immigrants%20Discussion%20Guide%20Part_1.pdf ==Read the book== *http://archive.org/details/nationofimmigran00kenn ==References== Category:Immigration to the United States
title: Nation of immigrants
